context: Regional logistics company evaluating transition to electric vehicle fleet for last-mile delivery operations

request.purpose: Procurement of 75 electric delivery vans and charging infrastructure for metropolitan delivery network
request.justification: Address 40% YoY e-commerce growth, achieve carbon neutrality by 2030, and comply with emerging urban emission regulations

decision_process.outcome: Electric vehicles feasible for 80% of routes
Scalable charging network designed with vendor partnerships
Approved with phased rollout over 18 months

business_impact.expected_outcome: Sustainable delivery operations with improved brand reputation, regulatory compliance, and market positioning as environmental leader
business_impact.projected_value: $3.2 million annual operating cost savings, $500K government incentives, $1.2M brand value enhancement

lessons_learned: Early utility company engagement crucial for charging infrastructure; consider battery leasing options to reduce upfront capital requirements; driver training programs essential for smooth transition; establish partnerships with charging network providers early in planning phase
